channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Report: Hamas Drops One of Its Major Demands in US-Brokered, 3-Phase Ceasefire Deal With Israel
Democrats' Senate hopes could hang on split-ticket voting comeback
item.description: Democrats may be relying on a potential resurgence in split-ticket voting to win Senate seats that President Biden could likely lose if he doesn't win a second term.

item.title: Rep. Jack Bergman to Newsmax: We Have a Crisis with Our Veterans
item.description: Rep. Jack Bergman, R-Mich., told Newsmax on Saturday that the U.S. has a mental health "crisis with our veterans and their families."

item.title: Does Joe Biden Have America's Allies Spooked Ahead of the NATO Summit?
Trump running mate contender Sen. Tom Cotton called 'a workhorse, not a show horse'
item.description: Sen. Tom Cotton, R-Ark., an Army veteran who served in combat in the Iraq and Afghanistan wars before becoming a rising star in Republican Party politics, is a Trump running mate contender.

item.title: Dick Morris to Newsmax: Best for Trump If Biden Stays in Race
item.description: Former President Donald Trump needs to just sit back and allow President Joe Biden's campaign to implode, political analyst Dick Morris said on Newsmax Saturday.

item.title: Trump Has Some Surprising—and Funny—Campaign Advice for Joe Biden
Biden decision to continue re-election campaign may come within days, Hawaii governor says
item.description: Hawaii Gov. Josh Green said President Biden could make a decision within days on whether he remains in the presidential election, as pressure mounts for him to drop out.

item.title: Rep. Tenney to Newsmax: It's the Biden Camp Versus the Dems
item.description: The first presidential debate showed a war is raging in the Democratic Party between those in the Biden administration who want to stay on for another four years and the Democrats who fear the president unpopularity may cost the election, Rep. Claudia Tenney said.

item.title: Here's Your Adam Kinzinger Laugh of the Day: What CNN Says About His Future in the GOP
Veterans respond to Biden claiming he's been 'in and out of battles': 'Don't make it about you'
item.description: After Biden's gaffe at the White House Fourth of July barbecue for military service members, one veterans' group called the remark a "disappointment."

item.title: Judge Declines to Throw Out Charges Against Nauta
item.description: The federal judge presiding over the classified documents case against Donald Trump refused Saturday to throw out charges against a co-defendant of the former president.

item.title: Hold Up: Judge Cannon Issues New Ruling That Delays Trump Classified Documents Case
Federal judge pauses deadlines in Trump documents case after SCOTUS immunity ruling
item.description: Multiple deadlines have been paused in former President Trump's Florida case as a federal judge allows arguments on the relevance of the Supreme Court's ruling on presidential immunity.

item.title: CNN Guest Admits Questions Were Given Ahead of Interviews
item.description: Two radio talk show hosts said Saturday that President Joe Biden's reelection campaign sent them questions for their interviews with him last week in the wake of his debate debacle.
